body_html: This is more of a stackoverflow question, so please re-ask there. I would suspect that you are better off batching multiple requests together into a single sess.run(). (i.e. use a producer consumer model), rather than trying to do a lot of sess.run()'s. TensorFlow was not designed to have lots of concurrent sess.run()'s. @mrry may have a better answer.

body: This is more of a stackoverflow question, so please re-ask there. I would suspect that you are better off batching multiple requests together into a single sess.run(). (i.e. use a producer consumer model), rather than trying to do a lot of sess.run()'s. TensorFlow was not designed to have lots of concurrent sess.run()'s.  @mrry may have a better answer.
